moves.1. d4 e6 2. e4 Bb4+: not a good move because of c3.
moves.3... Be7 4. Nc3: it seems now that the bishop on d2 is preventing from the queen to support the d4 pawn.
moves.4... Bb4: a waste of time. almost every move is better: Nc6, d5, b6, c5 etc.
moves.5. a3 Bxc3 6. Bxc3: bblack exchanged his active bishop (whom played 3 moves) with a non active knught (whom playrd once).
moves.9... c6 10. O-O Nbd7 11. Bd2: why? 11. Nd2 with f4 and Nf3 seems as a good plan.
moves.11... g6: maybe h6 is better. b5 is worth looking too.
moves.12. Bh6 Re8 13. g4: ?! white should try to pass f4-f5.
moves.13... e5 14. dxe5 Nxe5 15. Nxe5 dxe5: after all the exchanging on e5 black's position does not look that bad.
moves.16. f4 exf4 17. Rxf4 Qd4+: black attacks. now it more clear why g4 was not a good move.
moves.19. c3 Qd6 20. Qf3 Ne5 21. Qe3 Bxg4: I think that Qxd3 was better.
moves.23... Qh2+ 24. Kf1 Nxh6: ?? Nxe3  was clearly better and winning at once.
moves.27. Qxh6 Qxb2+ 28. Ke3 Qxa3 29. Bc4+ Kh8: 29... Qc5  30. Kd3 Rad8  and taking the bishop.
